split.name: split
split.description: Splits an SDF into chunks of predefined size (-i inputfile -o outputfile).

standardize.name: standardize
standardize.description: Chemical structure standardization (-i inputfile.sdf -o outputfile.sdf , recognized by extensions .sdf , .csv, .cml , .txt)

:neutralise.comment: If true neutralises the molecule via set of predefined SMIRKS

:splitfragments.comment: If true keeps the largest fragment

:implicith.comment: If true converts hydrogens to implicit

:generatestereofrom2d.comment: If true uses org.openscience.cdk.stereo.StereoElementFactory to generate the stereochemistry from 2D coordinates

:tautomers.comment: If true generates the top ranked tautomer

:inchi.comment: Generates InChIs. If -d tautomers=true InChI FixedH=true, otherwise generates standard InChI

:smiles.comment: Generates SMILES (isomeric, kekule).  Uses CDK SmilesGenerator.isomeric()

:smilesaromatic.comment: Generates aromatic SMILES.  Uses CDK SmilesGenerator.aromatic()

:pagesize.comment: Page size (in number of records). Set to -1 to read all records.

:inputtag_smiles.comment: Specifies the name of the column, containing SMILES in the input file

:inputtag_inchi.comment: Specifies the name of the column, containing InChI in the input file

:inputtag_inchikey.comment: Specifies the name of the column, containing InChIKey in the input file

:tag_inchi.comment: Specifies the tag to store the generated InChI

:tag_inchikey.comment: Specifies the tag to store the generated InChIKey

:tag_smiles.comment: Specifies the tag to store the generated SMILES

:tag_rank.comment: Specifies the tag to store the tautomer rank (energy based, less is better)

:tag_tokeep.comment: Specifies which tags to keep, comma delimited list. Everything else will be removed. To keep all the tags, leave this empty.

:sdftitle.comment: Specifies which field to write in the first SDF line null|inchikey|inchi|smiles|any-existing-field

:debugatomtypes.comment: Writes only structures with AtomTypes property set. For debug purposes

fingerprint.name: fingerprint
fingerprint.description: Fingerprint calculation. Writes multiple files per fingerprint, all files start with prefix given by -o prefix)

:fpclass.comment: Comma delimited list of class names implementing org.openscience.cdk.fingerprint.IFingerprinter, e.g. KlekotaRothFingerprinter. If not fully qualified will prepend 'org.openscience.cdk.fingerprint.'

:inputtag_smiles.comment: Specifies the name of the column, containing SMILES in the input file

:inputtag_inchi.comment: Specifies the name of the column, containing InChI in the input file

:inputtag_inchikey.comment: Specifies the name of the column, containing InChIKey in the input file

:tag_tokeep.comment: Specifies which tags to keep, comma delimited list. Everything else will be removed. To keep all the tags, leave this empty.

:write_count.comment: Whether to write the counts of getCountFingerprint()

:write_raw.comment: Whether to write the raw fingerprint (getRawFingerprint)

:sdftitle.comment: Specifies which field to write in the first SDF line

simmatrix.name: simmatrix
simmatrix.description: Similarity matrix from fingerprint files, as generated by the -a fingerprint command

:pagesize.comment: Page size (in number of records). Set to -1 to read all records.

dataset.name: dataset
dataset.description: Dataset import into AMBIT database (with normalisation). The database connection settings are read from -c {file}.

import.name: import
import.description: Quick import into AMBIT database (No normalisation!). Input file (-i file). The database connection settings are read from -c {file}

preprocessing.name: preprocessing
preprocessing.description: Preprocessing of structures in AMBIT database (depends on options, default inchi). The database connection settings are read from -c {file}

:atomprops.comment: Stores precalculated aromaticity/ring information in the structure table

:fp1024.comment: Hashed 1024 bit fingerprints, used for similarity searching anf substructure search prescreening

:sk1024.comment: Structure fingerprints, used for substructure search prescreening

:smarts.comment: Everything needed for substructure search prescreening - atomprops,fp1024,sk1024

:similarity.comment: Everything needed for similarity search - atomprops,fp1024

atomenvironments.name: atomenvironments
atomenvironments.description: Generates atom environments matrix descriptors from SDF file (-i inputfile -o outputfile)

:merge_results_file.comment: File with id tag and results to merge

:normalize.comment: Divide the AE counts on the sum of counts for thee level

:laplace_smoothing.comment: Laplace smoothing, provide alpha as argument. No smoothing if omitted

:levels_as_namespace.comment: Each AE level is a separate namespace

json.description: Displays JSON configuration of API commands

html.description: Generates HTML documentation for all API commands and runs examples
